subject: Torch relay location finder
description:
Ahead of November 7th, we need to update this page:

http://www.london2012.com/games/olympic-torch-relay/where-is-the-olympic-flame-going/locations-by-region-and-date.php

It will need to display all 1008 (ish) locations the torch will visit during the relay.

The method we have suggested for this is to provide filters.

When on the 'view by day' tab, you have a dropdown menu of days - filtering the locations.
Likewise, when on the 'view by region', you have a dropdown menu of regions.

Will provide some very rough mockups today.

Thanks

Will provide some very rough mockups today.

Thanks

Attached are the two mocks we discussed.

Suggest we have a chat tomorrow/friday to make sure we are clear on this.

There is one other update to the torch section, on  
http://www.london2012.com/olympic-torch-relay

at the bottom we need to add additional sponsor images - it was discussed in the original torch website release that we would update this at a later date to become a carousel - allowing us to put more images in.

Thanks,

Tom

Hi Tom, I have broken the carousel out to this ticket http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/5333 and renamed this ticket "Torch relay location finder" as it's likely that the two bits of work will be completed separability by different people here.

Jamie

Hi Tom/Andy,

The route finder is here for you to take a look at
http://locksley.london2012.com/games/olympic-torch-relay/where-is-the-olympic-flame-going/route-finder.php

You can add/edit the text on the page (just above the drop down) and I have updated the date format.

I also managed to get the evening celebrations flagged for you - currently it just says (evening celebration) in brackets.

Assume you want this to replace the existing 'Locations by region and date' page? Just check you have copied over any text images you want and confirm I'll replace that page with this one.

Jamie

Looks great Jamie,

Only two comments, one which is relatively urgent for Monday, one which can wait if needed.

At the moment we have a go button, but the trigger is when you close the dropdown (or switch selection in IE).
Could we remove the trigger from the drop down – and have it work just off the go button.

Secondly – if I provide you with an asset, could we have a branded button? I can get you the button asap.

Thanks again Jamie, very grateful!
Sure, no problem with either, we drop the onchange now and drop the button in once you send it over.

Go button attached ☺

Thanks!
PO being raised. Bill separately.

Tom, this is a separate issue and a long-standing one. If you need more feedback on what the issues are, Jamie will be able to give you feedback. 

It you do want us to investigate why particular events are not on the map, it would be helpful if you could give us some examples (although, warning: this may end up being time-consuming).

"Long standing issue" may not be the best wording ;-)

It may have just be that a call wasn't correctly made to Stamen's server from our end, we do try to resend automatically if this happens though so that is a bit odd. It may also be that Stamen failed to call the CMS to retrieve the page correctly (or that by the time they had the page had moved or been renamed). We only keep basic logs so this stuff is hard to debug retrospectively.

I am not entirely sure if Stamen limit the types of pages / the fields on the pages they receive at their end, or treat Events differently, although at the least I think they pick up the title for a page (if it's on the list of page types they except).

The first thing to test is that Stamen are getting sent pages. You can perform a simple test here, this is the url we use to poll Stamen about an page, if you add on the path to an Event after the path= then it should appear on the map 

The URL to call to tell Stamen about a page--->
http://data.map.london2012.com/kitsite-updates.php?path=events/competing-scarecrows.php

This causes Stamen to make a call back to our server for the XML for the page -->
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/events/competing-scarecrows.php?apiKey=f7AafqNZDa2Vt6NmS.Py3Q

Although not sure the second call back to us happens instantaneously, so if the page has been moved or renamed in the interim the call would fail.

Still investigating, but a couple of questions;

1) Do you have some concrete urls (not saying you making this up, but it's always easier if we are both looking at the same urls / pages).
2) Can I check this is the generic main Stamen map and not a special Events view within the main map?
3) When you say sporadic, is it really sporadic or do you think it's more that no new events are appearing and it's just new stories about events that are appearing? 

I have a recollection (and an in/out box with 200+ emails to/from Stamen whichI am reading though) that we did at one point do something specific re. Events, specifically round dates / type. Although looking at our code we call Stamen in exactly the same way regardless of what kind of page it is. However it is very possible, even likely (esp. if events are treated slightly differently) that Stamen are looking / checking for the existence of a field on an event that no longer exists and are therefore rejecting it.

Who's your most up to date technical contact at Stamen?

It may be worth checking if Stamen handle Events in a special way / checking for special fields? 

For example they should have been sent this event http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/events/competing-scarecrows.php?apiKey=f7AafqNZDa2Vt6NmS.Py3Q so may be worth checking if they would be rejecting it for any reason (assuming it hasn't made it to the map!)


Jamie

Following conversations today – probably best to put this on hold until next week at the earliest.

Hope thats ok,

Apologies!
Closing old tickets

> Can you tell me if it is possible to create a landing page for

It's not learning legacy specific but we do have a landing page for publication already here on the main site?
http://www.london2012.com/about-us/publications/index.php

Do you mean you want a version of this that is Learning Legacy specific on the main site? or is this for the standalone Learning Legacy site? 

To do something similar on the standalone Learning Legacy site we need to move across more than just an index page, we'd need to setup a new page/template for each publication, some publication entry tools, workflow and a search interface and backend similar to the main site. Or do you want it automated based on tags like the related photos etc on the main site, although bear in mind that there will be quite a jump in work between the manual and the automated versions (it's not just the component/promo itself but all the code that drives the related link selection that we'd need to migrate over to the new site).

Jamie

Uzma.

subject: Short URL appearing in search listings
description:
Hello

We have a short URL www.london2012.com/PressOperationsExchange which points to our B2B-only extranet called The Exchange.

This short URL is apparently allowing Google to index the extranet. Is it possible to suppress this short URL / redirect from search listings?

Similarly, we host in our CMS a temporary page http://www.london2012.com/temporary/press-operations/press-operations-extranet.html which redirects users - again, this is being indexed by Google. Can this be suppressed from search indexing?

Thanks!

Morag

From: Javaher Sondh
Sent: 02 November 2011 17:33
To: Jill Porter; Amy Field
Cc: Vanessa Hodge; Nicole Freeman
Subject: Exchange Registration

Hello all,

As you are aware, Press Operations have been receiving a going number of  registration requests from users who want to access other sites on Exchange.

After looking in to why this seems to be the case we found out this was likely because of the change in URL for the Press Operations registration page.  This is because when the URL www.london2012.com/PressOperationsExchange was created it enabled the page to be tracked and searched by Google.  This means that if anyone were to look up "The Exchange London 2012" on the search engine the would get the following results:

[cid:image002.jpg@01CC9985.2A22DE10]

With both the top two link directing people to the Press Operations registration site, it would be fair to assume that this is how many users have been able to register, in error, for the site.

As well as being an annoyance for you, there is the danger that access to the log in site could present a security risk.  With various sites on the Exchange containing private and confidential materials, combined with the fact that the Exchange was never intended to be a public facing share point tool, the sites appearance on Google has caused some concern.

Our understanding is that the URL was created by someone in New Media.  Can you please liaise with them to find a way to ensure that the Press Operations page no longer appears on Google?

Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any queries.

Regards,

Jav
Javaher Sondh
Information Management Coordinator
Information Knowledge Management

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
One Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London E14 5LN

Direct Dial 020 3 2012 722
Email javaher.sondh@london2012.com

Switchboard: +44 (0)20 3 2012 000
Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001
london2012.com<http://www.london2012.com/>

 Your Extranet people need to install a robots.txt file [http://www.robotstxt.org/robotstxt.html] at the root of the site.

Jamie

subject: FW: Translated news story - title length
description:
Hi,

Was there any news on this?

Thanks

From: Michael Thorne
Sent: 06 October 2011 14:24
To: 'support@kitsite.com'
Subject: Translated news story - title length

Hi,

We're trying to change the title on a French-language news story on the London 2012 website but are being prevented from doing so by an apparent character limit.

The story in question is here https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/fr/news/2011/09/les-chefs-de-mission-se-rendent-a-londres-pour-assister-a-une-reunion-d-info.php

The current title is  Les Chefs de mission se rendent à Londres pour assister à une réunion d'information sur les Jeux Paralympiques

We want to change it to  Les chefs de mission se rendent à Londres pour assister à une réunion d'information sur les Jeux Paralympiques
However, when we attempted to do so the following message appeared...

Value too large for column "KADMIN"."ITEM$"."DISPLAY_NAME" (actual: 83, maximum: 80) at "KADMIN.K$ITEM", line 1156 at line 1

Presumably this message pops up anytime you exceed the character limit, which seems straightforward. However, I'm a bit confused here as I'm not actually looking to change the character limit, so wonder how we were able to save it with 83 characters in the first place if there is an 80 character limit.

Does this character limit apply only to manual titles we create? i.e. as this is a returned translation, does it somehow bypass the standard character limit rules?

Thanks

Michael Thorne
Content Coordinator
Editorial Services department

Hi Jamie,

Please can you explain what you mean by ‘checked out’?

I’ve spoken to the person who set this up to publish and she said she didn’t do anything usual that would prevent it from working.

Thanks

Hi Michael,

See both the attached screen grabs, the lock/unlock is used to 'check out a page' manually.

When your editing a page the page is also checked out automatically and checked back in when you save the page. 

It's basically 'checked out' so that no one else can edit the page while you are editing it (only one person can update a single page at a time for obvious reasons)

Not saying that someone manually did this, there are occasions when a page isn't automatically checked in (your browser crashing before you close the page can cause this).

Although possibility is some other process checked the page out, for example the translation feed, locks or 'checks out' the page which it makes any automated updates to the page/

Jamie

subject: e-dialog signup integration
description:
Create 2 pages similar to this page [ https://www.london2012.com/settings/register.php ] for normal and business signups and one similar to the Festival signup form [http://festival.london2012.com/]. On page load the user should be presented with a box to enter their email address, on submission of this form/email the page should reload with a 'hole' in the middle of it for the iFrame (the contents of which will depend on the form specified and the users email address).Yes, that’s correct.

Clarification of requirements:

- Two new pages /settings/esignup.php (normal) and /settings/esignupb.php (business) [URL's TBC] both based on the same template using the layout of the exiting register page (header, footer, side nav)
- Design of form for user to enter their email address (based on login form, see attached) As per your mock up, essentially the existing login/signup page with the “Are you already registered with London 2012?” section removed 

- Implementation of functionality to check an email address was correctly entered and display an error message if not. 

- Implementation of functionality to convert email entered and page/form used (business or standard) into a eDialog url used to load the iFrame.

description:
From: Morag Reavley <Morag.Reavley@london2012.com>

Hello

Caught up with colleagues on this.

We would like to be able to continue featuring blog commenting when
password support is switched off.

What are the ramifications of the following solution:

1. A user who wants to comment has to fill in Screen name, email
address and comment fields, plus complete a captcha.

2. Comments go into the comment moderation functionality as presently
i.e. all comments are pre-moderated.

Do you think this would wash from a) a technical perspective b) a
security perspective (is this method inherently less secure than the
current approach)?

Hi Morag, We've half addressed the first issue, the other issues need some discussion as the fix / resolution isn't obvious or even achievable in some cases. A lot of the parsing errors Kieran has already investigated / discussed in another ticket which I am trying to dig out. In short the problem / solution is not clear cut - with many people arguing that what we are doing is correct and the parser / validator is wrong] Jamie 1) Frame titles - We have added a title to the eDialog iFrame [ title="Signup form" ] - But the Google+ iframe is actually written out by Google we just load a script which then rewrite the tags below into the iFrame that Ability.net are seeing. We therefore have no control of the iFrame code that Google writes into the page. 2a) Parsing errors - Doubleclick These are due to the Doubleclick tags? Not out writing out of them? We can remove the hspace="0" vspace="0" but need to check with Erin/Doubleclick/Google if this will cause issues. - Line 27, Column 251: there is no attribute "hspace" …ginwidth="0" marginheight="0" hspace="0" vspace="0" frameborder="0" scroll… Line 32, Column 125: required attribute "alt" not specified …gs_settings;sz=728x90;tile=1;lang=en;ord=1316513423?' width='728' height='90'/> 2b) Parsing errors - Google +1 This is because Google are using their own tag into the page. [This is a very well known, documented and discussed issue, the problem / solution is not clear cut - with many arguing that what we are doing is correct and the parser / validator is wrong] Line 67, Column 172: there is no attribute "size" …/plusone.js">
  • <… This issue is documented here: http://www.google.com/support/forum/p/Webmasters/thread?tid=51eb2ff3e340bc76&hl=en There are people suggesting using a
    tag instead of the but we'd need to investigate further if this will cause other issues, the code Tom supplied was in the format and that is the format Google suggest is used. 2c) Parsing errors - Facebook This is a very similar issue to above, namely Facebook specific tags which the W3C doesnt' like as is doesn't know about them. [Once again this is a very well known, documented and discussed issue, the problem / solution is not clear cut - with many arguing that what we are doing is correct and the parser / validator is wrong] Line 67, Column 379: there is no attribute "href" …4&xfbml=1"> and tags are not part of the document, but the W3C validator seems to ignore the namespace declaration. Kieran spent quite an amount of time investigating this a few weeks back when we added the Google +1 tags. It may be best if II let him explain direct (to you or whoever need to know). 3) Non-text content [ref: 1.1.1] – LOCOG logo needs descriptive The site says "LOCOG logo" across the site it always has, ironically I think we were previously told to use "LOCOG logo" as it was descriptive of the image (along the acronym LOOCG probably isn't that obvious). If you want we could change it, but I don't think we should change it only in one place? hence we'll need to bulk republish the site, this is unrelated to the e-signup pages specifically. Is changing this a priority for launching eDialog? 4) Focus visible [ref: 2.4.7] – Three Stylesheet links show no focus indicator This is common to the whole site, I am not sure this has ever been an issue before / it was never in the designs. Once again this is a moderately significant site wide change, unrelated to the e-signup pages specifically, I think we probably need to agree what this wil look like . check it cross browser first before rolling it out. Is changing this a priority for launching eDialog?
See http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/5012 "the 2012 home page doesn't validate" raised by Kieran a couple of weeks ago.

Danny,

Need to be careful with this ticket / what it contains, there is a multitude of tasks that may or not be getting tracked correctly, there may be other tickets that cover a sub set of these tasks.

subject: Thoughts on London Prepares accessibility
description:
Hi all. We're publishing the new www.londonpreparesseries.com pages in a few minutes. All's well, just a bunch of new sports with events to publicise. We do have one issue we could use your advice on though. Abilitynet sent us the feedback below when we enquired specifically about www.londonpreparesseries.com/goalball . The Goalball pages will be read by a lot of blind people so we're keen to make them in particular as accessible as possible. I figure there are reasons Cogapp coded stuff in the way they did, and don't know where you may have influenced / altered any of the below, but do you have any thoughts as to whether AbilityNet's suggestions below are implementable without causing any disruption? Issue The text 'London International Goalball Tournament' in the header (see Fig 4) of all pages is not read by screen readers as it is currently only coded as:
. [cid:image001.jpg@01CC7C3D.CC3B2820]Fig 4 - Page title Recommendation It is recommended that this text be coded with

, as the first header of each page. Issue There is also an issue with the footer as Fig 5 below shows. The left section of the footer has a heading element used for no content (see the code section below). Code:

International Federation

There is also an issue with the header on the right side of the footer, 'International Federation' as this should not be coded as a header as it is not a heading. [cid:image002.jpg@01CC7C3D.CC3B2820] Fig 5 - Site footer with headings Recommendation It is recommended that the h3 tags in this instance are removed as they are not necessary and will be confusing for screen reader users. Code 'International Federation' with the

element. Hi Finn, The very short answer, based on past experience, is that if this is going live soon it's extremely risky to change anything (less so the change, most the danger that the change could cause more noticeable issues which we then find we dont' have time to resolve and have to revert back to what we had before, given that we have Akamai caching turned on this can often cause even more confusion/difficultly as the CSS becomes out f sync with the site). The changes are sensible, so happy to make them, but we need a sensible timescale (ie. not in the next few minutes!) 1) "The text 'London International Goalball Tournament' in the header (see Fig 4) of all pages is not read by screen readers as it is currently only coded as:" I think this should be
London International Goalball Tournament
which is then hidden for most uses via CSS (and replaced with an image). ** I may be able to get this change ie. text added into the
in for you in the next hour, I jus need to double check that it won't appear under the image as text in any circumstances ** In terms of change the
to a

I am not sure why CogApp didn't do this, but before I go in like a bull in a china shop, I probably need to look at the consequences of doing this. 2) "There is also an issue with the footer as Fig 5 below shows." I expect the reason for this is that there is padding or a height / width assigned to the left hand H3 (which does sometimes have content) if we take it out I expect we'll see the footer colapse. I am sure we coudl recode this and put the height/width or padding on a wrapper
but this is not the sort of whim we want to make on a whim as it could cause issues elsewhere on the site. Why we are using a

I am not sure, it's not something we would do, but I expect CogApp had a reason for doing so. As mentioned above we can look at recoding, but not without taking time to look at why it is coded like that and what are implications of recoding it. Jamie
Hey, soz if I was unclear, wasn’t suggesting you make them now :-) Fine to do it at your own pace if that can be sometime this week?

I expect the first will be fairly easy to address, the second more tricky.

Although the first seems like a major oversight (excuse the pun) / embarrassment, when advertising a blind sport even so will try and get that one looked at with the highest priority (ie. today).

The second, while not technically correct, I expect won't actually cause anyone serious issues in terms of navigating the site on a screen reader - although will look into that as well, but probably not till later on in the week.
Much appreciated

Hi Finn,

I have updated the logo with alternative text (you can actually do this yourself by editing the relevant header component in <sport>/includes/header) [see attached screen shot 1]. 

https://londonprepares.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/goalball/includes/header.html

I have only updated Goalball, will leave you to check/amend the others.

In terms of turning it from a <div> tag into a <h1> tags I did actually do this [see attached screen shot 2 and 3 for before and after]. 

But....

 Then noticed this has a unwanted side effect on the news pages as they already have a <h1> tag, so we now have two [see attached screen shot 4]. 

We can't just change the <h1> into a <h2> as we already have different styles applied to the <h2> additional we shouldn't have two <h1> tags as when Google see's two <h1> tags there is evidence that it discards both and just uses the page title.

Furthermore because the header component is a shared include and  doesn't know about the page it is included in, we can't conditionally write out different tags depending on the page.

I have therefore reverted the image header back into a <div>, although it now does now have the fallback text.

Am yet to look at the footer.

Jamie
Cool, thanks Jamie. Will take a view on whether we need a revamp to deal with the <h1> / <h2> / <div> issues but I’m thinking it’s unlikely we’d pursue that.
Closing..

subject: Kitsite CMS updating the new stamen map
description:
We have built a new stamen map environment consisting of a new app and presentation server to replace app01 and pres03 that have not been modified since 2008.

The new boxes will be called
locoggs2ssmapp01.btgs2.bt-locog - 
this is the tile server which replaces app01

locoggs2ssmweb01.btgs2.bt-locog    IP 213.120.228.146     URL Origin-newmap.london2012.com
this is the web server and replaces pres03

which will both be accessible through akamai.

As the Kitsite CMS communicates with the web server this will need to be activated for the new map so that the Kitsite CMS updates the new Web server.

Mike Migurski from Stamen has asked for a call with Jamie from Kitsite in the first instance so that they can understand how to make this all happen.
